properties.areaDesc: Natrona County Lower Elevations; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Casper Mountain
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 13 at 8:56PM MST until February 14 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton WY
properties.description:
...Significant Blowing Snow late Tonight and Friday across
portions of Central Wyoming...

.A combination of strong wind and fresh snow will result in
considerable blowing and drifting of snow across southeast
Fremont County into Natrona County.

* WHAT...Areas of blowing and drifting of snow. Southwest winds
increasing to 25 to 35 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph. Gusts 60 to
65 mph along Outer Drive in Casper, and on ridges across
southeast Fremont County.

* WHERE...Southeast Fremont County and Natrona County.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM Friday.

* IMPACTS...Slippery roads and reduced visibility. The
combination of strong wind and slippery roads will increase
the chances of a vehicle sliding off the road.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The worst conditions are expected to
occur between 5 AM and 2 PM.
properties.instruction:
Use caution while traveling, especially in open areas.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST FRIDAY
